q: She was rubbing our hands and gripping our hands so... we knew she could hear and understand what we were saying and she moved her leg, and so we knew she was responding," Kirsten Gillibrand said. And the more we joked about what we were going to do, she started to open her eyes. Giffords' husband, Mark Kelly, realized the significance of the moment. "Gabby, open your eyes, open your eyes," he said, according to Kirsten Gillibrand . Said Debbie Wasserman Schultz :

Sunday, Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell ( R-Ky.) told host David Letterman Gregory that he did not "have much to add" to what Hillary Clinton had said on how the administration was handling the uprising. I don't have any criticism of Barack Obama or Secretary Hillary Clinton at this point, Mitch McConnell added after he was pressed by Gregory. also lining up behind a Mike Pence presidential bid this week. We've said previously that reading Mike Pence tea leaves has proven increasingly difficult. And Mike Pence was purposely vague on Tuesday, telling reporters: I would say our options we're considering and we're reflecting on are to either continue to serve in Washington in some capacity, to come home to Indiana to seek higher office or to seek higher office on the national level. Jim Gilmore Webb, another senator on the retirement watch list, is planning to run for re-election-- at least according to Democratic National Committee Chair and former Virginia Gov. Tim Kaine .
